metadata.synopsis: After the lanceboard game (HAV_MolsDeal_Lanceboard_ThreeWay.lsj), Mol will slink off away from Raphael and can be spoken to alone to discuss his deal. This dialogue can happen as long as the inn has not been attacked yet.After the game with Raphael, Mol can be found in a corner by a dusty shelf, where she's shoved the lanceboard. She clearly stole a piece from the set, fiddling with it as the player approaches.
metadata.how_to_trigger: - Load SCL_Main_A- Talk to Mol and Raphael at the lanceboard (-61, 132)- Find Mol at the bar (-72, 143)- Click to talk to her

82.speaker: Mol
82.text: Wonder if I could con some gold off that cleric.
82.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mol is fiddling with a piece of the lanceboard set. She pockets it behind her back before talking to the player.NodeContext: Disappointed.

99.speaker: Mol
99.text: Should've trusted my gut instead of asking for help.
99.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mol is fiddling with a piece of the lanceboard set. She pockets it behind her back before talking to the player.NodeContext: Disappointed.

101.speaker: Mol
101.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mol is fiddling with a piece of the lanceboard set. She pockets it behind her back before talking to the player, smilingNodeContext: Very pleased.

105.speaker: Mol
105.text: If we put our heads together, I bet you and me could make a tidy stack of coin in Baldur's Gate.
105.context: NodeContext: Subtext is thinking about herself. She's advising a kid not to deal with a devil. It's a quiet convo so not to dramatic, but very sincere on Karlach's part.

112.speaker: Mol
112.text: But Raphael's offered me a partnership already, and it seems like a sweeter deal than throwing my lot in with you.
112.context: NodeContext: Subtext is thinking about herself. She's advising a kid not to deal with a devil. It's a quiet convo so not to dramatic, but very sincere on Karlach's part.

21.speaker: Player
21.context: NodeContext: Subtext is thinking about herself. She's advising a kid not to deal with a devil. It's a quiet convo so not to dramatic, but very sincere on Karlach's part.

88.speaker: Karlach
88.context: NodeContext: Subtext is thinking about herself. She's advising a kid not to deal with a devil. It's a quiet convo so not to dramatic, but very sincere on Karlach's part.

67.speaker: Player
67.text: Make a deal with a devil, little one. Once you fall, you'll never look back.

87.speaker: Player
87.text: Make a deal with a devil, little one. Once you fall, you'll never look back.

76.speaker: Mol
76.text: Hey! I'm not so little! Grown-up enough to have grown up ages ago.

52.speaker: Player
52.text: Though it can be near-impossible to stay on the good path, you have to try. We all have to try.

116.speaker: Player
116.text: You need to stay away from Raphael. His deals are poison.

13.speaker: Player
13.text: Like a prick from a scorpion, Raphael's deals seem innocuous, but they are poison.

5.speaker: Mol
5.text: You must love the taste of it. He seems to know you pretty well.

57.speaker: Player
57.text: I know him well enough to know he's a trickster.

47.speaker: Mol
47.text: Whatever. I'm tired of taking orders from people who think they know better than me.

59.speaker: Mol
59.text: Do as I say, not as I do, right? Got a lot of that from Zev too, and he was a walking pile of imp shite at the end of the day.

74.speaker: Player
74.text: I haven't made any kind of deal with him. He's just trying to tempt me.

50.speaker: Player
50.text: My problems are more urgent than yours - I have to deal with him.

22.speaker: Player
22.text: What exactly did he offer you?

32.speaker: Mol
32.text: Protection for me and my kids. That's all.

20.speaker: Player
20.text: *Her smile is broad, her eyes twinkling, her face the very picture of innocence. She's clearly lying.*

70.speaker: Mol
70.text: *Her smile is broad, her eyes twinkling, her face the very picture of innocence. She's clearly lying.*

37.speaker: Narrator
37.text: *Her smile is broad, her eyes twinkling, her face the very picture of innocence. She's clearly lying.*

31.speaker: Mol
31.text: But I haven't accepted nothing yet. Sounds like you're in deeper than I am.

75.speaker: Player
75.text: Raphael's dangerous, Mol. What did he really offer you?

72.speaker: Mol
72.text: What I said! That he'd get me and my gang safely to Baldur's Gate.

27.speaker: Mol
27.text: What I said! That he'd get me and my gang safely to Baldur's Gate.

19.speaker: Mol
19.text: And also... when we get there, I'd be head of the Thieves' Guild.

15.speaker: Player
15.text: Trust me, it might sound good but it's not worth it.

117.speaker: Mol
117.text: Easy for you to say - you can do what you want, go where you want. My kids need protecting, and I'm going to protect 'em.

56.speaker: Player
56.text: And what happens to the current head of the Guild?

71.speaker: Mol
71.text: I dunno, devil stuff? What matters is I can keep my kids safe. Everyone else's let them down, but I won't.

93.speaker: Mol
93.text: I had the grove running pretty smooth, I'll do the same in Baldur's Gate. And I can keep the kids safe.

63.speaker: Mol
63.text: I had the grove running pretty smooth, I'll do the same in Baldur's Gate. And I can keep the kids safe.

68.text: Everyone they turned to let my kids down - the druids, Zevlor, everyone. Now it's my job to keep 'em safe, and I'm gonna do it right.

97.speaker: Mol
97.text: Everyone they turned to let my kids down - the druids, Zevlor, everyone. Now it's my job to keep 'em safe, and I'm gonna do it right.

90.speaker: Player
90.text: I haven't made a deal. He's just trying to tempt me.

8.speaker: Mol
8.text: Looked like he was doin' a pretty good job. If I had to deal with gods and worms in my head, I'd make a deal with anyone.

100.speaker: Mol
100.text: Not like we have anyone in charge now. Zev's dead.

6.speaker: Mol
6.text: Look, you saved us. Not knockin' that. But after you left, Zevlor lost his nerve - gave up the fight. I won't.

106.speaker: Mol
106.text: You could have helped us. With the goblins, with the druids. But you saved your own skin.

89.speaker: Mol
89.text: I get looking out for number one - respect it, even. So if I make a deal, you can be damn sure it's what's best for me and my crew.

81.speaker: Mol
81.text: Now there's no grove, no coin, no one taking us to the city. I'm not letting my crew get eaten by shadows.

104.speaker: Mol
104.text: Maybe I'll make a deal, maybe I won't. But it'll be my choice - not the devil's and not yours.

46.speaker: Mol
46.text: Zevlor couldn't save everyone - it's my job to look after those who survived.

62.speaker: Player
62.text: My problems are a lot more pressing than yours.
62.context: NodeContext: She scoffs before saying "You hero types are all the same."

80.speaker: Mol
80.text: Yeah, I bet. What kind of problems could someone like me have? You hero types are all the same.
80.context: NodeContext: She scoffs before saying "You hero types are all the same."

58.speaker: Player
58.text: I can read you like a book, Mol - call it hunter's instincts. Now tell me, what did he really offer?

9.speaker: Player
9.text: This isn't about me, it's about your soul. What did he really offer?

41.speaker: Mol
41.text: He said he could get me and my gang get to Baldur's Gate. I reckon he can do it too - don't care what your 'lore' says.

96.text: He said he could get me and my gang get to Baldur's Gate. I reckon he can do it too - don't care what your 'lore' says.

14.speaker: Mol
14.text: He said he could get me and my gang get to Baldur's Gate. I reckon he can do it too - don't care what your 'lore' says.

83.speaker: Player
83.text: Devils of lore don't deal in such low stakes, Mol. What'd he really offer?

115.text: Not that it's any of your business - I'm not poking my nose into whatever trade you made with him.

114.speaker: Mol
114.text: Not that it's any of your business - I'm not poking my nose into whatever trade you made with him.

49.speaker: Player
49.text: I'm not judging, Mol. Only curious about the details.

42.speaker: Mol
42.text: Safe passage to Baldur's Gate. Safe from everyone, like Zev was supposed to do.

24.speaker: Player
24.text: Simply professional curiosity, Mol. Devils of lore don't usually deal in such low stakes.

16.speaker: Player
16.text: If Raphael offered you a good trade, you should take it.

26.speaker: Mol
26.text: No idea if it's good or not. A lot of people like to promise pretty things, but it's empty air.

4.speaker: Mol
4.text: Did he deal with you straight? Heard you two talking.

33.speaker: Player
33.text: I'm holding out. Better to make him a little desperate.

85.speaker: Mol
85.text: Yeah, that's the way to go. His lanceboard trick was meant to soften me up, but I know better.

30.speaker: Player
30.text: Take the deal if you want, kid. But a word of advice - let him get a little desperate first.
30.context: NodeContext: solider said with maximum sarcasm

10.speaker: Player
10.text: Our kind have enough trouble with devils. You should stay away from this one.
10.context: NodeContext: solider said with maximum sarcasm

54.speaker: Mol
54.text: If our kind looked out for one another, we wouldn't need to deal with devils.

79.speaker: Player
79.text: Raphael is a real, literal devil. You and your soul are in danger, Mol.
79.context: NodeContext: solider said with maximum sarcasm

0.speaker: Player
0.text: Raphael is a real, literal devil. These creatures care not for you - only your soul.
0.context: NodeContext: solider said with maximum sarcasm

25.speaker: Mol
25.text: You... you aren't joking? Huh. I kind of believe him more now than I did a minute ago.

35.speaker: Mol
35.text: You... you aren't joking? Huh. I kind of believe him more now than I did a minute ago.

44.text: Whatever. My soul's not gonna matter if we get eaten by shadow freaks.

17.speaker: Mol
17.text: Whatever. My soul's not gonna matter if we get eaten by shadow freaks.

98.speaker: Player
98.text: Do you not hear it? The power of the Nine Hells, woven in his every word? He is a devil who wishes for your very soul.
98.context: NodeContext: solider said with maximum sarcasm

55.speaker: Player
55.text: You need to believe in yourself, Mol. Not the empty promises of a fork-tongued monster.
55.context: NodeContext: solider said with maximum sarcasm

12.speaker: Mol
12.text: Zevlor had belief - didn't get him anywhere good. Besides, Raphael wasn't promising anything stupid.

103.speaker: Player
103.text: One should consider all options before forming a battle strategy - not just the easiest deal.
103.context: NodeContext: solider said with maximum sarcasm

92.speaker: Mol
92.text: There aren't any other options, soldier. Raphael said he could keep me and my kids safe, and that's that.
92.context: NodeContext: solider said with maximum sarcasm

7.speaker: Player
7.text: I swore a pact with a creature like Raphael once. He's a devil, Mol. Be cautious.

11.speaker: Mol
11.text: So what if Raphael's a devil? Means he's got the power to keep his promise.

36.speaker: Mol
36.text: Also - bit rich for you to tell me who I can or can't make deals with. All things considered.
